summary.tagline: A neurodivergent-first, AI-native, quantum/DNA/neuromorphic-ready programming language.
summary.core_message: Programming languages are more than syntax; they are an expression of how minds think.
summary.big_idea: Design a language that fits dyslexic, ADHD, autistic and AI minds by default, while bridging classical, quantum, and molecular computing.

goals: Support visual, spatial, textual, and audio coding views
Make accessibility a default, not a plugin
features: Block + text + spatial code representations kept in sync

goals: Treat AI as a pair programmer, not autocomplete
Make human validation explicit in the language
Let the language teach the AI your style
features: Annotations for AI-generated vs human-written code
Preference profiles and audit trails for AI suggestions

goals: Unify classical, quantum, DNA, and neuromorphic computing
Hide low-level device details behind clear abstractions
Support hybrid workflows as a first-class norm
features: Inline quantum kernels with automatic classical-quantum data handling
High-level DNA circuit and sequence design primitives

goals: Steal the best ideas from esolangs without the chaos
Blend imperative, functional, reactive, and declarative modes
features: Readable, math-friendly notation where it helps understanding
Optional spatial/code-on-a-grid execution views (Befunge-style but safer)
FRP and constraint/logic blocks alongside normal functions

mantra.short: Code for every mind. One language, all paradigms.
mantra.hype: Yo mate, imagine a language built FOR how some of the smartest neurodivergent brains actually think — super visual, minimal noise, and riding the edge of quantum, DNA, and AI. That’s HyperCode. Join us or watch the future get built around you.
